title: Kelly's Tigers deflect 'doubters,' topple Clemson

content: The BJP is livid with Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra over her alleged comments against Union Minister Amit Shah. Her comments have drawn massive condemnation from the party, with various leaders making strong remarks.

content: Those on the OBC list are eligible for reservation in government jobs, but students need to be on the SEBC list for accessing educational concessions such as scholarships and reservation in admissions.

content: Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok threatened to launch a Chamundeshwari chalo rally on the lines of the Dharmasthala one and lashed out at the Congress for ‚Äúhurting the sentiments of Hindus‚Äù

content: The State Archaeology department spent ‚Çπ36 lakh on construction, while the government granted ‚Çπ1.6 crore in 2021

content: The yatra has given the Congress a platform to reassert its relevance, but its success will depend on translating public enthusiasm into electoral gains by strengthening the party‚Äôs organisation and crafting a sharper economic message

content: The study is aimed at investigating submerged remains and bringing out Tamil Nadu‚Äôs maritime past. The proposals have been sent to the Central Advisory Board of Archaeology for clearance

title: Karnataka could lose ‚Çπ 15,000 crore annually from Centre‚Äôs two-slab GST proposal, says CM Siddaramaiah
content: When the GST was introduced in 2017, compensation was to be provided to States for a period of five years. Now, with a growth in tax by about 12% to 13%, the amount should also be compensated for the State, he says

content: The infection-causing amoeba is found in waterbodies; steps had been taken to chlorinate all wells on August 30 and August 31

title: Upalokayukta criticises inefficient officers in Raichur, books 18 suo motu cases for lapses
content: Terming corruption the biggest enemy, Veerappa says action against inefficient and corrupt officers will be very harsh

title: Assault on YouTuber Shajan Scaria: police register case against five
content: According to the FIR, the accused blocked the YouTuber‚Äôs vehicle, manhandled him, and attempted to murder him. Police say the accused are absconding

content: The body of Nehkam Jomhao, a member of the delegation that met leaders of Meitei organisations in Imphal a few weeks ago, is yet to be recovered

content: The path leading to the normal and emergency tunnels of the Dhauliganga power project in the Ealagarh area near Dharchula in the district was blocked due to a landslide caused by heavy rains

title: Magsaysay Award for 'Educate Girls' a historic moment for India: non-profit's founder Safeena Husain
content: Starting from Rajasthan, Educate Girls identified the neediest communities in terms of girls‚Äô education, brought unschooled or out-of-school girls into the classroom, and worked to keep them there until they were able to acquire credentials for higher education and gainful employment, the Ramon Magsaysay Award Foundation said

content: Project worth ‚Çπ82.66 lakh to enhance Pullu‚Äôs natural beauty under the State‚Äôs Destination Challenge initiative¬†

content: Mr. Edappadi Palaniswami urged the Tamil Nadu government for creative steps to ensure there is no impact in the production in the textile industry in the State.

content: The ED‚Äôs investigation revealed that the funds mobilised in the Bikebot scam were diverted to various related companies, and subsequently layered through educational trusts, societies, and individuals

content: Mr. Stalin arrived in¬†D√ºsseldorf¬†on August 30 to begin his eight-day visit to Germany and the United Kingdom, aimed at strengthening investment partnerships and engaging with the global Tamil diaspora.

content: The actor, reportedly battled cancer for over two years and died at the age of 38 at her residence in Mira Road, Mumbai

content: Intensified inspections aims at ensuring student safety and lawful celebrations during the festive season, say police

content: Amendments to Municipalities and Panchayat Raj Acts made amid similar Bills awaiting assent of President

title: India set for wetter September; IMD warns of flash floods, landslips
content: Northwest India recorded 265 mm of rainfall in August, the highest for the month since 2001 and the 13th highest since 1901, according to the IMD

content: ‚ÄúBRS is trying to create obstacles in the passage of Bills paving the way for implementation of 42% reservation to BCs,‚Äù Telangana CM Revanth Reddy said in a debate in the Legislative Assembly

title: Election Commission of India targets new voter cards for all Bihar voters post SIR
content: Officials said while the plan is to issue every Bihar voter with a new voter card, a final call on when and how the exercise will be carried out is yet to be taken

title: Nod for movement of multi-axle vehicles on Thamarassery Ghat Road
content: The road was completely closed to vehicular traffic on August 26 after mud slips and falling of rocks were reported on the ninth hair pin curve

title: Kerala launches new intensive mission to mitigate human-wildlife conflict
content: Help desks would be set up in affected grama panchayats and local elected representatives and officials would listen to the suggestions and complaints and try to address their concerns

title: FIR against TMC MP Mahua Moitra for ‚Äòobjectionable‚Äô remarks against Amit Shah in Chhattisgarh
content: Mahua Moitra sparked a controversy after allegedly saying that if Mr. Shah fails to stop infiltration from Bangladesh, "the first thing you should do is cut Amit Shah's head and put it on your table"

title: PM Modi, President Xi express commitment to fair, reasonable resolution of boundary issue
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the Chinese President Xi Jinping for the BRICS summit which India will be hosting in 2026

title: Senior IPS officer G. Venkatraman appointed as Tamil Nadu DGP in-charge
content: This is the first time in recent years Tamil Nadu is not following the Supreme Court ruling in the appointment of DGP. List of eligible DGP rank officers have been sent to UPSC for empanelment, say official sources

title: Tamil Nadu has lowest density of rosewood tree population in south India, finds study
content: Often called the ‚Äúivory of the forests,‚Äù Indian rosewood is prized for its rich grain, deep colour, and exceptional durability.

title: Godavari floods: Second warning issued at Bhadrachalam; officials discharge 10.41 lakh cusecs from Polavaram project
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi has directed the State Disaster Response Force and the flood duty officers to be alert and take up rescue-and-rehabilitation operations in the cut-off habitations

title: Blast in firecracker factory in Lucknow, two killed
content: A part of the roof collapsed following the explosion, trapping at least two other individuals under the debris

title: More flash floods, landslides? IMD warns India set for wetter September
content: India is expected to receive above-normal rainfall in September, exacerbating the already extreme monsoon season. The IMD warns of potential disruptions like landslides and floods, particularly in Uttarakhand and other regions. Northwest and South Peninsular India have already experienced unusually heavy rainfall, leading to devastating floods and landslides in several states.

title: Big bloc, strong words: SCO flexes global influence; what role is India playing?
content: Leaders from the Shanghai Cooperation Organization's ten member states, including India, Russia, and China, are convening in northern China. The SCO, seen as an alternative to US-led approaches, encompasses 40% of the world's population.

title: 'Hold Bihar SIR again': Congress says EC rejected 89 lakhs complaints
content: Pawan Khera alleged that the Election Commission dismissed approximately 89 lakh complaints of irregularities raised by Congress's Booth Level Agents during Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Khera questioned the EC's intentions, claiming that BLAs' complaints were rejected with the directive that only individual complaints would be accepted, not those from political parties.

title: 'Nothing is more disgusting than a child bully': Who is Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek?
content: Piotr Szczerek, CEO of Drogbruk, faced immense backlash after a video surfaced showing him snatching a signed hat from a child at the US Open. Social media users identified Szczerek and his company, leading to a flood of negative reviews and criticism. Tennis star Kamil Majchrzak who signed the hat responded to the row and tracked down the child, Brok, and gifted him a new signed cap and other memorabilia.

title: Citizenship promise: An entire country is shifting to Australia; first agreement of its kind
content: Nearly 9,000 Tuvalu citizens, representing 82% of the population, have applied for Australia's new climate visa program. This initiative, part of the Falepili Union pact, aims to provide a pathway for mobility as climate impacts worsen. The agreement also commits Australia to defend Tuvalu and gives them a say in Tuvalu's defense pacts.

title: Drama! Millionaire CEO bullies child on camera at US open - Watch
content: At the 2025 US Open, CEO Piotr Szczerek ignited global outrage by snatching a signed cap from a child. Identified as the head of Drogbruk, he faced immediate backlash, including negative reviews and deactivated social media. Tennis star Kamil Majchrzak responded by gifting the boy new memorabilia, highlighting Szczerek's reputational crisis.

title: Abu Obeida killed: Israel eliminates Hamas spokesperson, confirms Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that the military targeted Abu Obeida, the spokesman of Hamas‚Äôs armed wing. This announcement comes amidst Israel‚Äôs ongoing war in Gaza, during which it has eliminated key Hamas figures. Hamas confirmed the death of Mohammed Sinwar, believed to be its leader in Gaza, adding another layer to the conflict's complexities.

title: From orphan to 150 caps: Pathak makes history for India at Asia Cup
content: Krishan Bahadur Pathak, the Indian men's hockey goalkeeper, celebrated his 150th international cap during the Hero Men‚Äôs Asia Cup 2025 match against Japan. Overcoming immense personal adversity, including being orphaned at a young age, Pathak has become a mainstay in the Indian team since his debut in 2018.

title: AI tie-ups: Google CEO, Meta‚Äôs Zuckerberg; Partner with Reliance on Superintelligence
content: At Reliance's AGM, Sundar Pichai and Mark Zuckerberg highlighted partnerships with Reliance to propel India into an AI-powered era. Zuckerberg envisions delivering personal superintelligence to every Indian through open-source AI models. Pichai announced a Google Cloud region in Jamnagar, dedicated to Reliance, to support AI adoption across Indian businesses and industries.

title: Eagles‚Äô 2025 Rookies: PFF rankings erupt; instant NFL impact shakes preseason
content: Philadelphia's 2025 rookie class is already turning heads, with Willie Lampkin, Antwaun Powell-Ryland, and Andrew Mukuba earning spots on PFF's Preseason All-Rookie Team. Lampkin's potential on the offensive line, Powell-Ryland's pass-rushing prowess, and Mukuba's impactful plays in the secondary showcase the Eagles' focus on developing young talent. These rookies signal a promising future for Philadelphia.

title: 'India not schoolkid': US journalist slams Trump's Russia oil tariffs
content: American journalist Rick Sanchez of Russia Today has criticized the US for imposing secondary tariffs on India over Russian oil, calling it disrespectful and ignorant. He highlighted India's autonomy in choosing oil suppliers as a transformational moment, noting India's significance on the global stage.

title: US emabassy: Discontinued from Aug; only two options left for passport/visa pickup
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the U.S. will no longer allow third-party passport collection. Applicants must collect their passports in person, with parental collection required for those under 18 with a consent letter. Alternatively, applicants can opt for home delivery at a cost of Rs 1,200 per applicant, ensuring enhanced security.

title: Big blow! Sarfaraz Khan ruled out of action for three weeks with injury
content: Sarfaraz Khan's hopes for the upcoming Test season have been dashed as a quadriceps injury sustained during the Buchi Babu Tournament has ruled him out of the Duleep Trophy. Dhruv Jurel is also sidelined with a groin injury, while Tilak Varma will miss the tournament due to Asia Cup duty, resulting in Azharuddeen leading South Zone.

title: White House denies entry to actor Dyan Cannon; what did she lie about?
content: Dyan Cannon, 88, faced an unexpected White House lockout due to a discrepancy in her passport age. Accompanied by fellow actresses and a chef for their podcast, 'God's Table,' Cannon's past age fib caused a delay. Despite the hiccup, Cannon humorously embraced the situation, reaffirming that age is just a number.

title: Pak's Punjab faces biggest flood in history: 33 killed, 7 lakh evacuated
content: Severe flooding in Pakistan's Punjab province, exacerbated by global warming, has impacted two million people, marking the region's biggest flood in history. Heavy monsoon rains have caused three rivers to reach unprecedented water levels, leading to widespread evacuations and significant damage.

title: Hockey Asia Cup: Harmanpreet scores twice; India beat Japan 3-2
content: Captain Harmanpreet Singh scored twice as India edged Japan 3-2 in their second Pool A match of the men‚Äôs Asia Cup. Mandeep Singh added an early goal for India, while Kosei Kawabe netted twice for Japan. India had opened their campaign with a 4-3 win over China and will face Kazakhstan next, with the winner earning a World Cup spot.

title: Touching tribute! PM Modi to retired Pujara: 'Team's fate was in safe hands'
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, after retiring from all cricket forms, received a heartfelt appreciation letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cricket. Modi lauded Pujara's resilience, temperament, and pivotal role in Test cricket, especially his remarkable performances in challenging overseas conditions.

title: Shedeur Sanders' message to Deion Sanders: Proves Sanders legacy of resilience
content: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.

title: Daylight murder in Bengal: 19-yr-old shot twice by boyfriend in front of family
content: In Krishnanagar, a 19-year-old girl, Isha Mallik, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend, Debraj Singha, at her home on Monday afternoon. The police reported that the victim was shot twice at point-blank range after she decided to end their relationship. The accused is currently absconding, and a manhunt has been initiated by the police to apprehend him.

title: 'We don't eat beef': Salim Khan on family's food choices
content: Salim Khan revealed his family's long-held tradition of abstaining from beef, rooted in Prophet Mohammed's teachings emphasizing the cow's importance. He highlighted the seamless integration of Hindu traditions in his life, predating his marriage to Salma Khan.

title: 'Was saving money for wedding': Indian-origin truck driver dies in Autralia road crash
content: Jagseer Boparai, a 37-year-old Indian-origin man, tragically died in a car accident in Salisbury, Australia. He lost control of his car, colliding with a tree, bus shelter, and power pole. The accident occurred just weeks before his planned return to India for his wedding, devastating his family and the local community.

title: India-China ties: PM Modi stresses 'strategic autonomy'; message for Trump?
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Xi Jinping, during the SCO Summit in Tianjin, affirmed India and China as development partners, not rivals, emphasising the need to prevent differences from escalating into disputes. They acknowledged their crucial role in stabilising global trade amid US tariffs and discussed expanding bilateral trade, investment and reducing the trade deficit. PM Modi invited Xi to the BRICS summit in India in 2026, highlighting strengthened bilateral relations.

title: MS Dhoni as Team India mentor? Ex-cricketer takes a dig, says 'woh phone uthaye hain na?'
content: Reports suggest the BCCI has approached MS Dhoni to mentor the Indian team for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Manoj Tiwary humorously commented on Dhoni's elusiveness, questioning his availability. Tiwary also highlighted the potential benefits of Dhoni's experience and the intriguing prospect of him working alongside Gautam Gambhir, while emphasizing that Dhoni's acceptance of the role remains uncertain.

title: India‚Äôs AI demand surges: 10 roles, 1 engineer; skills crisis explained
content: India's booming AI industry faces a critical talent shortage, with only one qualified engineer available for every ten Generative AI job openings. This scarcity drives salaries sky-high, particularly in AI, cloud computing, and cybersecurity. Tier-2 cities are emerging as tech hubs, fostering greater inclusion and offering new opportunities, but urgent upskilling is needed to sustain India's digital growth.

title: Bihar CEO dismisses allegations of duplicate voters in draft rolls
content: The Bihar CEO refuted media reports of widespread duplication in the draft electoral rolls (SIR 2025), deeming the claims premature and speculative. He clarified that the draft rolls are open for public scrutiny, inviting objections and verification.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann seeks Rs 60K cr from Centre; schools closed
content: Punjab is grappling with severe flooding, prompting Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to request Prime Minister Modi to release Rs 60,000 crore in pending state funds. The floods, triggered by heavy rains and dam water releases, have devastated seven districts, submerging farmland and impacting livelihoods. The state government has extended school closures and seeks revised disaster relief compensation norms for farmers.

title: 53-year-old man kills 10-year-old girl after failed rape attempt; held
content: In Firozabad, a 53-year-old man was arrested for the murder of a 10-year-old girl. The accused lured the Class 2 student into a millet field with the intention of sexual assault. When he failed in his attempt, he strangled her with a rope and hid her body, fearing she would reveal his crime.

title: Kerala bank canteen row: Manager bans beef; staff serve dish in protest
content: Employees of Canara Bank in Kochi, under the BEFI banner, protested against the regional manager's alleged ban on serving beef in the bank's canteen. The employees served beef on the premises, claiming the manager, instructed the canteen staff to exclude the dish due to his personal dietary preferences.

title: 'Fuelling anti-semitism fire': Why are Israel and US angry at Macron?
content: French President Emmanuel Macron‚Äôs decision to recognise a Palestinian state has drawn sharp criticism from Israel and the US. Netanyahu accused Macron of ‚Äúfueling antisemitism,‚Äù while Macron defended the move as vital for peace and in response to Gaza‚Äôs humanitarian crisis. The US backed Israel, even as several countries plan similar recognition during the upcoming UN General Assembly.

title: 19-year-old athlete killed in road accident with SMC garbage van in Surat
content: Vidhi Kadam, a 19-year-old athlete and B.Com student, tragically died in Surat after her scooter collided with an SMC garbage van. The accident occurred while she was on her way to the gym. The van driver, who only possessed a learner's license, has been arrested. Vidhi was a promising athlete, holding records and with aspirations for state and national competitions.

title: Spurned lover out on bail stabs woman for second time in three years
content: The woman suffered head injuries and was admitted to a private hospital in Kuniyamuthur, where her condition is stable.

title: 'How many more days in this?': Rishabh Pant's injury update goes viral
content: Rishabh Pant is determined to get back on the cricket field after fracturing his toe during the Test match against England. Pant shared a photo of his bandaged foot on Instagram, expressing his eagerness to recover.

title: 'Threatened to fail': UP school principal rapes 11-year-old student
content: In Aligarh, a government school principal has been arrested and suspended following allegations of raping an 11-year-old Class 7 student. The principal, aged 50, is accused of sexually assaulting the girl, performing obscene acts, and threatening to fail her if she resisted.

title: 'Endangering health': Sanders urges Trump's health secretary to resign
content: Senator Bernie Sanders has urged US health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr to resign, citing actions endangering public health. Sanders criticizes Kennedy's anti-vaccine stance and promotion of debunked conspiracy theories, highlighting the dismissal of the CDC director and resignations of other officials. He warns Kennedy's policies could undermine access to essential immunizations and threaten the childhood immunization schedule.

title: 'Made me famous world over': SC judge on stray dogs case
content: Justice Vikram Nath humorously acknowledged the global attention he received after his bench overturned a ruling on stray dogs in Delhi-NCR. He expressed gratitude to CJI BR Gavai for assigning him the case, noting the widespread recognition, even from dogs.

title: Pavitra Rishta fame Priya Marathe passes away at 38 after battle with cancer
content: Television actress Priya Marathe, known for her roles in Marathi and Hindi serials, passed away at her Mumbai residence on August 31 at the age of 38. She had been battling cancer for several years. Marathe gained recognition for her performances in 'Kasamh Se,' 'Pavitra Rishta,' and 'Bade Acche Lagte Hain,' leaving behind a legacy of memorable characters and versatility.

title: US tariffs: India readies steps to protect exporters; domestic demand push in focus
content: In response to the US tariff hike, the government is preparing measures to protect industries and workers, focusing on employment-heavy sectors. Economic Affairs Secretary Anuradha Thakur expressed confidence in achieving the fiscal deficit target, citing strong macroeconomic fundamentals, robust capex, and broad-based economic expansion reflected in the 7.8% growth in the April-June quarter.

title: ‚ÄòForced to drink urine‚Äô: UP jail inmates allege inhuman treatment, families protest
content: A probe has been initiated in Kasganj district jail following allegations of severe inmate mistreatment. Prisoners claim they were tortured, with one forced to drink urine, after the new jail superintendent took charge. Relatives and lawyers protested inhuman treatment and extortion. A wife alleged her husband was beaten and she faced an inappropriate search.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on work obsession: Mind always on company
content: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, revealed his intense dedication to work, blurring the lines between his professional and personal life. He admitted to constantly thinking about Nvidia, even during leisure activities, highlighting the relentless drive behind the company's success. This extreme work ethic has propelled Nvidia to a $4 trillion valuation, reflecting a culture of long hours and unwavering focus.

title: Where will your team's next ballpark be? What Royals can teach us about the future of MLB stadiums
content: The K is located in the Truman Sports Complex, next to Arrowhead Stadium . your feelings about that location might depend on how you view the relationship between baseball and the cities in which it is played . in 2021, so long ago that Bobby Witt Jr. had not yet debuted in the majors, Royals owner John Sherman announced a search for a new venue .

title: What went wrong with the Braves this year -- and how to fix them
content: from 1991 to 2005, the Braves won 14 division titles in 15 seasons, missing only during the strike year of 1994 . from 2018 to 2024, they won six division titles, including 100-win seasons in 2022 and '23, and featured one of the most powerful lineups of all time .

title: Premier League updates: Man City take on Brighton, Forest host West Ham
content: We continue our live coverage on this final weekend before the international break with several standout matchups across Europe. In the  Premier League ,  Brighton & Hove Albion  will be desperate for their first win of the season as they welcome  Manchester City , who are aiming to rebound from last weekend's defeat to  Tottenham Hotspur . Later comes the headline clash:  Liverpool  vs.  Arsenal , a meeting between two title contenders that promises to be one of the games of the season. Elsewhere,  Borussia Dortmund  host  Union Berlin  in the  Bundesliga ; in  Serie A ,  Genoa  face  Juventus . Enjoy all the highlights and big moments across Europe from Sunday's action.

title: Who has a shot at the championship? Projecting conference and Finals winners
content: this season, the Oklahoma City Thunder will look to become the first back-to-back champions since 2018 . but there will be plenty of challengers . the new york Knicks have plenty of postseason experience to push even fury .

title: Why the Cowboys love spring football -- and how it pays off in the fall
content: the Dallas Cowboys signed wide receiver/return specialist KaVontae Turpin in 2022 . they have combined for four pro Bowl appearances -- two apiece -- and are considered one of the best, if not the best . the cowboys hope he can be the third success story from spring football .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands as final month approaches
content: alden Gonzalez and Jesse Rogers weigh in on who they like most to come out on top of the American League wild-card race . teams are mostly split into three categories: those preparing for the playoffs, those trying to make a run at contention and those whose focus has turned to next season . there's still a fair amount to play for within those groups .

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?
content: nneka Ogwumike's clutch bucket at the buzzer gives the Storm an 84-82 win over the Mystics . sports experts contend there's no such thing as a consistent clutch player in any sport . who are the biggest clutch shooters in the WNBA, when a game is on the line .
